Question: Before I do something, I think about the good and bad things that can happen.
I can stick to my plans and goals.
I often think about what will happen in the next few days or weeks.
I set goals for what I want to do or have a few years from now.
I would rather save my money for something I might need later than spend it on something fun now.
I spend more time on what I have to do (like homework) than on things I want to do (like playing games).
I can control the way I act.
I can solve hard problems or puzzles if I keep working on them.
I think saving money is something both kids and adults should do.
I don’t have to buy things my friends have.
I don’t need to have a lot of money and expensive things.
I plan for how I'll spend my money.
I’m good at keeping track of how much money I have and spend.
I can reach my money goals.
Before I buy something that costs a lot, I learn about my options to find the one that’s right for me.
I know how to protect my money from being lost or stolen.
Compared to others my age, I know more about how to save money.
Compared to others my age, I know more about how to spend money within a budget.
Compared to others my age, I know more about how to borrow money and pay it back.
Compared to others my age, I know more about how to make money by doing jobs, chores, or other things.
